Description: Largely intact, though worn, pottery bowl; ring foot badly damaged; white slip; applied wavy band on top of lip and arcading on wall; worn painted decoration inside and out; on the interior, four verticals quarter the wall, two given 'branches'; each quarter seems to have had different decoration of large dots and curving lines; on the exterior, much cross-hatching, but also some dots and lines.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IC.185)
Swaddling 1986 / Italian Iron Age artefacts in the British Museum : papers of the sixth British Museum Classical Colloquium (p. 187)
